result.execSummary:
The defendant Quentin L. Figures was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Quentin L. Figures is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Quentin L. Figures was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No contact with victim - Christina Branch.
Any/all evaluations/counseling as deemed necessary/appropriate by DOC.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quentin L. Figures

records.addlTxt: 09:41 AM Defendant Quentin L. Figures in court with attorney Jeffrey Ocwieja.  Defendant Quentin L. Figures in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Quentin L. Figures appeared by video.  Defendant wishes to proceed to plea and sentencing today via video.   Defendant formally waives right to be present at sentencing.   State recites joint recommendation:  Ct 1: dismissed.  Ct 2:  W/H 18 mo probation, consecutive to existing cases/sentences; no contact with victim; any evaluations/counseling as deemed appropriate by DOC; costs + $100 DV.    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.  Guilty plea given/entered.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation.  Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.
State's response to motion to dismiss bail jump charges
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 16, 2020 at 09:30 am.

State's Requested Jury Instructions and Proposed Special Verdict
State's Motion for Admission of Fact Prior Convictions at Trial

Attorney Kyle Robert Reimann in court.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Quentin Figures is brought to court by law enforcement.  There is an allegation that the defendant has been in violation of no contact order.  Atty Reimann denies any further violation of any law and objects to the arrest of the defendant today.  He also objects to any bond based on no criminal complaint filed.  ADA Allen responds, gives court an overview of report of violation.  State requests signature bond converted to $350 cash bond with all original conditions.
Atty Reimann, again, objects to any change of bond.  States the defendant lives in Milwaukee and is only here for court.  Judge rules that defendant be allowed to return to Milwaukee without any further bond amendment(s).
